name: paratactically
content:
Add to word list

in a style that uses parataxis (= two clauses or phrases without a conjunction (= connecting word) between them to show their relationship): In written language, an extensive set of markers exists to mark relationships between clauses, but in spoken language the chunks are often paratactically organized. The style does not build an argument, but rather proceeds paratactically from image to image.
More examplesFewer examplesFour of these clauses are paratactically related to the main clause.These verses simply describe the Lady by adding bodily and emotive features paratactically.
